txt.en: 'So tell me, what did you experience as you meditated upon the ancient glories of Lothlórien...?\n\n'My, that seems a bit odd. I recall my experience rather differently.'
Circles of Silence
You quietly meditate for a time
'The Peaceful Glade is your first destination through the Circles of Silence.'
You quietly meditate for a time
'The Peaceful Glade is your first destination through the Circles of Silence.'
You quietly meditate for a time
The Peaceful Glade lies north of Egladil.\n\nGalhíril suggested you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> in the Peaceful Glade.
'The Ring of Melbrethil is your second destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'Oh my, so now strangers wander beneath the boughs of Lothlórien, exploring our customs as their own?'
You quietly meditate for a time
The Peaceful Glade lies north of Egladil.\n\nGalhíril suggested you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> in the Peaceful Glade.
'The Ring of Melbrethil is your second destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'Be not rude my dear. With the Darkness that comes upon us all, so must come change - even to our precious forests.'
The Ring of Melbrethil lies to the north of the Peaceful Glade.\n\nGalhíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Ring of Melbrethil.
'The Stone-grove is your third destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'Not even we have the power to hold back the tides of time forever.'
The Ring of Melbrethil lies to the north of the Peaceful Glade.\n\nGalhíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Ring of Melbrethil.
'The Stone-grove is your third destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'I know what you say is true, my dear, but must such change come upon us so swiftly? 'Tis unseemly and unsettling.'
The Stone-grove lies well to the south-west of the Ring of Melbrethil.\n\nGalhíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Stone-grove.
'The Elder Circle is your fourth destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'The Elder Circle is your fourth destination through the Circles of Silence.'
'Now you are being childish for the sake of your own amusement! Be quiet and give our guest a moment's peace.'
The Stone-grove lies far to the south-west of the Ring of Melbrethil.\n\nGalhíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Stone-grove.
The Elder Circle lies to the south-east of the Stone-grove.\n\nGlahíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Elder Circle.
The Elder Circle lies to the south-east of the Stone-grove.\n\nGlahíril suggested that you <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within the Elder Circle.
Galhíril is in Egladil.\n\nYou should return to Galhiril and tell her of your meditations within the circles of Lothlórien.
<rgb=#FF0000>Meditate</rgb> in the Peaceful Glade
<rgb=#FF0000>Meditate</rgb> in the Ring of Melbrethil
The thunderous roar of the nearby waterfall makes relaxation difficult at first, but soon seems to recede into the background.
<rgb=#FF0000>Meditate</rgb> in the Stone-grove
<rgb=#FF0000>Meditate</rgb> in the Elder Circle
Talk to Galhíril in Egladil
The raven
There is an ancient tradition in Lothlórien, wherin one travels throughout the forest, visiting a series of stone glades and meditating within each.
A raven perched upon the highest pillar eyes you curiously.
You get the strangest sensation that it has been waiting there for a very long time for something...
A peaceful silence falls upon the glade, as neither breeze nor birdsong can for a moment be heard.

'By the way, [placeholder], have you yet come upon the ancient circles of Lothlórien? They were raised so long ago that few of our tales even speak of their origins.

'Those among us who feel the need to remind ourselves of our origins often go to these ancient glades and <rgb=#FF0000>meditate</rgb> within them, recounting years long past.

'Perhaps you should attempt this pilgrimage? I would be most interested to hear your thoughts upon it should you complete it.'
